title: Requirements Engineering
text:
Announcement: The result of the reading tests are online, check your gradebook. If you failed the test, yet you read the book: please contact me to convince me face to face that you really read it and the test was flawed.

If you passed the test, yet you DID NOT read the book like you should have, please let me know after the course and help me improve the test. 

You can hand-in your assignments on the following location!
[[re-course-material]]

title: Requirements Engineering course material
text:
All the information about the seminars can be found at the following location: [[re-seminar]].

You can hand in your work on the following location: [[re-work]].

title: Requirements Engineering seminar
text: Every week we give seminars! Next week it is about prototyping. You can already access the assignments: [[re-seminar-work-2]] today!

title: Requirements Engineering work
text:
Check these pages every week! We have extra work for the persons that would get an A: [[re-course-extra-work]].

The rest of the work is all group work. You can find the assingments on the following location: [[re-course-group]]

title: Philosophy
text:
An introduction to modern philosophy, from the Renaissance to the present, with careful study of works by Descartes, Hume, Kant, and others. Emphasis is placed upon the complex relations of philosophy to the development of modern science, the social and political history of the West, and man's continuing attempt to achieve a satisfactory worldview. 

Course materials can be found here: [[philosophy-course-materials]] 
Please hand in assignments on time. Descriptions and upload forms are here: [[philosophy-assignments]]
An example exam can be found here: [[philosophy-example-exam]].

Success!

title: Philosophy - course materials
text:
Pleas read the following materials:

Week 1: [[philosophy-paper-1]], [[philosophy-paper-2]] 
 Week 2: [[philosophy-paper-3]]
 Week 3: [[philosophy-paper-4]]
Week4: [[philosophy-paper-5]], [[philosophy-paper-6]], [[philosophy-paper-7]].

title: Philosophy - Assignments
text:
There are only two assignments:
Assignment 1 (end of week 2): [[philosophy-assignment-1]],
Assignment 2 (end of week 4): [[philosophy-assignment-1]].

title: Philosophy - Assignment 1
text:
Please write an essay about Plato.
Upload your results here: [[philosophy-assignment-1-upload]].

title: Philosophy - Assignment 2
text:
Please write an essay about Descartes.
Upload your results here: [[philosophy-assignment-2-upload]].

title: Philosophy - Example exam
text:
1. Should knowledge of a future psychological disruption make you indifferent to any fortune or misfortune that succeeds it?
2. Were you once a foetus?
3. Is there anything wrong with conceiving of miracles as contraventions of the laws of nature?
4. Is there a convincing version of the cosmological argument?
5. Do theists need to answer the problem of evil? Can they?
6. Explain and illustrate the difference between over-determination and pre-emption. Why does this difference matter for theories of causation?
7. Are causes necessary and/or sufficient for their effects?
